Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.

Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.

Aufgaben

Deine Leidenschaft


Eigenverantwortung für die Planung, Konzipierung und Realisierung von Data Science Projekten
Durchführung komplexer Datenanalysen
Vorhersagemodelle unter Anwendung moderner statistischer Analysemethoden und mathematischer Modelle entwickeln
Methoden in den Systemen unserer Kundschaft zur optimierten Steuerung der Geschäftsmodelle und Prozesse implementieren
Aufgaben der Modellierung und Datenanalyse (z.B. Forecasting, Recommendation, Clustering, Classification, Reporting)



Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kund:innen echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.

Qualifikation

Dein Talent


Deutsch-Kenntnisse auf C1 Niveau - Beherrschung der Sprache (German Fluency is a must)
Masterabschluss vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, Statistik, Physik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Data Science
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region



Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!

Benefits

Unser Versprechen

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:


Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.
Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.
Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.
Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.
Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.
Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.
Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.
Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.
Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.



Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Data Scientist - Consumer (Global Discovery)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join the Search & Ranking team within consumer discovery on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.


Develop and Optimize Search Algorithms: Enhance and research new search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization, to deliver the most relevant results to our users.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work as part of a cross-functional team, including Backend Engineers, Product Managers, and Data Engineers, to improve our global search end-2-end.
Analyze and interpret large datasets: Extract meaningful insights to understand relevance problems.
Innovate and Experiment: Identify and apply the best machine learning and statistical methods to solve complex problems, ensuring solutions are scalable and effective in production environments.
Navigate Ambiguity: Define and tackle data science problems amidst ambiguity, ensuring clear problem definitions and actionable insights


At Delivery Hero, you’ll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you’ll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

What you need to be successful


Experience: Master’s degree (or Bachelor’s with 4+ years of work experience) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Theoretical Chemistry, or similar. 2+ years of experience as a data scientist working on applying data science fundamentals to solve complex business problems
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and Python and its ML ecosystem is essential. Experience with Java and Scala is a plus.
Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of a wide variety of ML and statistical methods, including Classical ML, Deep Learning, NLP, and Recommendation Systems. Ability to discern the most suitable approach for different problems.
Search and Ranking ML Algorithms: Hands-on experience with search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization.
Problem-Solving: Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of navigating it to define clear data science problems and solutions. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical solutions.
Collaborative Spirit: Proven experience working in cross-functional teams, contributing effectively to joint projects and achieving common goals. Excellent communication skills to articulate complex ideas and influence stakeholders.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
About The Opportunity

Are you ready to unlock the next level of data insights from an evolving Analytics product at Contentful? We’re looking for a skilled Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d) to build systems that apply Bayesian statistical models and (un)supervised machine learning models to billions of event data points. This is an exciting opportunity to work close to where the action happens, right at the intersection of advanced analytics, cloud technologies and product development.

As a Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d), you will work closely with our data engineers, product managers, and backend engineers to design, implement, and optimize statistical algorithms, ML systems and analytics solutions.

What to Expect?


Design, develop, and deploy advanced statistical models and machine learning systems to deliver actionable insights and enhance platform performance at scale.
Build systems that analyze billions of event data points, identifying trends, uncovering opportunities, and enabling effective attribution analysis for our customers.
Collaborate with product managers and designers to create intuitive and visually impactful representations of data, setting new standards for customer engagement.
Spearhead initiatives in A/B testing, predictive modeling, customer behavior analysis, and attribution modeling to guide product and business strategies.
Stay at the forefront of industry advancements by exploring and implementing emerging data science techniques, keeping Contentful’s analytics capabilities best-in-class.


What You Need To Be Successful


Several years of professional experience in data science roles. A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar is beneficial.
Proficiency in Python and data science libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Proficiency in SQL for querying large-scale datasets and a strong understanding of database optimization.
Solid understanding of probabilistic and statistical methods, including their application in A/B testing, attribution modeling, and predictive analytics.
Strong foundations in neural networks, deep learning algorithms, and architectures (e.g., CNNs, RNNs, Transformers).
Familiarity with CI/CD workflows, Git version control; Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform is nice to have.
Familiarity with cloud-native data stacks, such as Google Cloud Platform tools (BigQuery, Dataflow, Vertex AI), or similar ecosystems.
Knowledge of MLOps practices and tools such as MLFlow, Kubeflow, Wandb, or Ray.
Familiarity with TypeScript for collaboration with backend teams is great but not required.


What’s in it for You?


Join an ambitious tech company reshaping the way people build digital experiences
Full-time employees receive Stock Options for the opportunity to share in the success of our company
Fertility and family-building benefits, including a lifetime reimbursable wallet to support your growing family.
We value Work-Life balance and You Time! A generous amount of paid time off, including vacation days, compassion days for loss, education days, and volunteer days
Use your personal annual education budget to improve your skills and grow in your career
Enjoy a full range of virtual and in-person events, including workshops, guest speakers, and fun team activities, supporting learning and networking exchange beyond the usual work duties
An annual wellbeing stipend to care for your physical, financial, or emotional health
A monthly communication stipend and phone hardware upgrade reimbursement
New hire office equipment stipend for hybrid or distributed employees. Get the gear you need to work at your best.


Who are we?

Contentful is the intelligent composable content platform that unlocks all of an organization’s digital content to deliver impactful customer experiences, making content a strategic business asset. The Contentful Platform, Contentful Studio, and the Contentful Ecosystem combine the flexibility of composable content with the intelligence of AI, empowering digital teams to drive business momentum through collaboration, speed, and scale. Contentful powers innovative content experiences across brands, regions, and channels for organizations around the world, including nearly 30% of the Fortune 500. Nearly 800 people from more than 70 nations contribute their energy and creativity to Contentful, working from hubs in Berlin, Denver and distributed around the world.

Everyone is welcome here!

“Everyone is welcome here” is a celebrated component of our culture. At Contentful, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed. We invite you to apply and join us!

If you need reasonable accommodations at any point during the application or interview process, please let your recruiting coordinator know.

Please be aware of scammers who may fraudulently allege to be from Contentful. These types of fraud can be carried out through copycat websites, fake email addresses claiming to be from our company, or social media. We do not ask for your personal information such as bank account numbers, identification numbers, etc through social media or chat-based apps, nor do we request or send money for the purchase of business equipment. If you suspect fraud, please report it to your local authorities, as well as reaching out to us at security-esk@contentful.com with any information you may have.

By clicking “Apply for this job,” I acknowledge that I have read the “Contentful’s Candidate Privacy Notice”, and hereby consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of my personal information as described therein.

Title: Deep Learning Researcher
Description:
About Avo Intelligence

Avo Intelligence operates at the forefront of machine learning innovation, delivering transformative solutions that empower businesses to unlock the potential of their data. Based in Singapore, we specialize in providing world-class machine learning expertise that drives impactful results across industries such as finance, healthcare, logistics, and smart urban planning. With a network of highly skilled professionals experienced in raw machine learning applications, we are dedicated to fostering innovation and delivering meaningful outcomes for our clients.

About The Role

We are looking for passionate machine learning professionals to collaborate with our clients on revolutionary projects across a range of industries. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge research and development in fields such as computer vision, natural language processing (NLP), and machine learning, while working closely with cross-functional teams to bring impactful solutions to life.

Tasks


Conduct advanced research and development in areas such as computer vision, natural language processing, generative AI, and machine learning.
Collaborate with partners and engineers to develop or optimize models and algorithms, ensuring seamless transfer of innovations into practical applications.
Publish high-quality research in top-tier conferences and journals, showcasing groundbreaking work.



Requirements


Ph.D. or equivalent expertise in computer science, electrical engineering, or related fields, with a focus on areas like generative AI, computer vision, NLP, or machine learning.
Hands-on experience in developing algorithms and models using deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and programming languages such as Python or C/C++.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex ideas effectively.



Benefits


Work with some of the brightest minds in the machine learning field, tackling industry-specific challenges and pushing the boundaries of innovation.
Collaborate on diverse projects that span industries and make a tangible impact.
Be part of a global network of ML experts who are passionate about solving real-world problems through raw machine learning applications.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation GmbH




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing personalized recommendations including size and fit, style, and alternative product suggestions. Our technologies support shoppers and retailers alike by reducing returns, increasing conversions, enhancing customer satisfaction, and ultimately helping the environment.




As a trusted partner of leading global apparel and footwear retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to optimizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.




Role Overview:

Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Senior Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in driving the success of our cutting-edge recommendation solutions. As a seasoned professional, you will contribute to projects in production with your strong ML and SWE skillset. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to pave the way forward with innovative ideas and bring them to life.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop state of the art solutions for apparel sizing, style, and product recommendations.
Experience with implementing the lifecycle of ML solutions
Champion best practices in code quality, review, and software architecture.
Drive continuous innovation in ML techniques and strategies to maintain competitive advantage and keep pace with industry standards.
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align ML technologies with business goals and enhance customer outcomes.




Requirements and Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Senior Data Scientist, particularly in recommendation systems and scalable ML solutions.
Proficient in Python and SQL.
Extensive experience with ML frameworks and tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and ML serving technologies like TensorFlow Serving or NVIDIA Triton.
Proficient in developing and optimizing ML pipelines, model deployment, and serving strategies.
Strong record of software engineering best practices, including testing, data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis.
Proactive attitude towards organizational growth, personal development and developing team spirit
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively with all levels of an organization.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Senior Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning solutions that optimize our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Translate business needs into data science questions and take ownership of the research and development of Machine Learning solutions that bring positive business impact
Partner with engineering and product teams to deploy Data Science services and embed them in the Auto1 tech infrastructure
Monitor model performance in production, share results with stakeholders and develop actionable next steps
Identify business opportunities and collaborate with stakeholders and partners in tech to drive growth
Set priorities and support junior members to achieve project goals


Qualifications


At least 2 years of hands-on experience working with deep learning/neural networks. Experience with recommender system and pytorch would be considered an advantage
Proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience in AWS/Azure/Google Cloud would be considered an advantage.
Proficiency in the full lifecycle of data science projects, including initializing/designing, developing (building the model), and deploying models in production (full stack)
Advanced statistical and quantitative knowledge with commercial experience, preferably with academic experience in a quantitative research field
Demonstrated strong stakeholder interaction and visualization skills to effectively present findings in a clear and unambiguous way


Additional Information


Working from home: you can work from home up to 5 days a week
International teams
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development
Personal growth with the contribution of own ideas
Exciting team events like Hackathons to foster collaboration and innovation
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars


Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Senior Software Developer Data & ML (m/w/d)
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Software Developer Data & ML (m/f/d) to join our team in Berlin.




About Technology&Strategy:

Technology&Strategy is a Franco-German consulting company with more than 3000 employees in Germany, France, Belgium, Spain, Portugal and Switzerland. We work on the innovative technologies of tomorrow in the automotive, aerospace, financial and energy sectors. Our goal is to create smarter, safer and more environmentally friendly solutions for the challenges of the future.




Our promise to you: Find a place where you will enjoy your work, be challenged and encouraged.

Progression at T&S means contributing your own ideas in a challenging, international environment to support your career and the growth of the company!




Key job responsibilities

Work directly with the science and engineering teams to build scalable systems for AI reasoning with LLMs
Build a system that generates automatically annotated data with an existing reasoning engine (AI planner, simulator, proof planner)
Handle large-scale data annotations and automate pre/post-processing pipelines, including data lake management in S3 and compute resources.
Build pipelines for training and fine-tuning LLMs
Build an experimental test harness able to run experiments in multiple domains with the minimum of adaptation.
Play an active role development in an international setting (Berlin, and Boston)




Basic qualifications

Strong knowledge in building scalable data processing pipelines ideally with AWS
3+ years of experience in Analytics, and Data Engineering (DE) experience with evidence of increasing responsibility
Experience in scripting for automation (e.g. Python) and advanced SQL skills.
Capacity to independently lead and execute end to end insight projects, including asking the right questions, managing complex datasets, iterating on findings, and providing strategic guidance and recommendations to an engineering team
Ability to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, use of strong baselines, ability to accurately determine cause and effect relations
Exceptional oral and written communication skills, effectively communicating complex business concepts and influence senior stakeholders




Why T&S?

Flexible working hours, home office option, 30 days holiday and special leave days for special occasions
Permanent employment contract
Modern office space + IT equipment + kitchen, coffee machine and drinks for free
Individual career programme with long-term prospects through regular follow-up discussions with HR and managers
Numerous training opportunities, paid language courses & a digital T&S learning platform
Monthly events with your own team
Flat hierarchies
Access to discounts with up to 800 brands (Corporate Benefits)
Supplementary Health Insurance
The possibility of a company car
Company-wide relocation possibility if desired




Our positions are open to recognized as disabled workers.

T&S Group promotes diversity and equality in the workplace.

All qualified M/F/O candidates are considered for employment on an equal basis.

HTML:
We are looking for a Senior Software Developer Data & ML (m/f/d) to join our team in Berlin.


About Technology&Strategy:

Technology&Strategy is a Franco-German consulting company with more than 3000 employees in Germany, France, Belgium, Spain, Portugal and Switzerland. We work on the innovative technologies of tomorrow in the automotive, aerospace, financial and energy sectors. Our goal is to create smarter, safer and more environmentally friendly solutions for the challenges of the future.


Our promise to you: Find a place where you will enjoy your work, be challenged and encouraged.

Progression at T&S means contributing your own ideas in a challenging, international environment to support your career and the growth of the company!


Key job responsibilities

  • Work directly with the science and engineering teams to build scalable systems for AI reasoning with LLMs
  • Build a system that generates automatically annotated data with an existing reasoning engine (AI planner, simulator, proof planner)
  • Handle large-scale data annotations and automate pre/post-processing pipelines, including data lake management in S3 and compute resources.
  • Build pipelines for training and fine-tuning LLMs
  • Build an experimental test harness able to run experiments in multiple domains with the minimum of adaptation.
  • Play an active role development in an international setting (Berlin, and Boston)


Basic qualifications

  • Strong knowledge in building scalable data processing pipelines ideally with AWS
  • 3+ years of experience in Analytics, and Data Engineering (DE) experience with evidence of increasing responsibility
  • Experience in scripting for automation (e.g. Python) and advanced SQL skills.
  • Capacity to independently lead and execute end to end insight projects, including asking the right questions, managing complex datasets, iterating on findings, and providing strategic guidance and recommendations to an engineering team
  • Ability to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, use of strong baselines, ability to accurately determine cause and effect relations
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills, effectively communicating complex business concepts and influence senior stakeholders


Why T&S?

  • Flexible working hours, home office option, 30 days holiday and special leave days for special occasions
  • Permanent employment contract
  • Modern office space + IT equipment + kitchen, coffee machine and drinks for free
  • Individual career programme with long-term prospects through regular follow-up discussions with HR and managers
  • Numerous training opportunities, paid language courses & a digital T&S learning platform
  • Monthly events with your own team
  • Flat hierarchies
  • Access to discounts with up to 800 brands (Corporate Benefits)

  • The possibility of a company car

All qualified M/F/O candidates are considered for employment on an equal basis.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Pricing Team (6 month contract) (m / f / d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio's vision is to enable seamless travel for people anywhere, in any way. We are bringing all global transport options into a single distribution system to create magical end-to-end consumer journeys.

With Omio, you can easily compare and book trains, buses, ferries, and flights across Europe, the US, and Canada using a single search on your mobile, app, or desktop. Omio aims to simplify travel planning by providing transparent pricing and easy booking, making it a flexible and personalised experience.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, working with over 1000 suppliers across 39 countries. Our portfolio also includes Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, attracting over 900 million users annually.

Our offices are located in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London. We are a growing team of over 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who all share the same vision: to create a unified tool to help travellers reach almost any destination in the world.

Job Description

Please note: This is a newly created role offered as a 6 month contract, however, we anticipate this transitioning to a permanent post.

Omio is building the future of travel pricing. We’re moving from manual, rule-based systems to AI-driven dynamic pricing to enhance revenue, efficiency, and competitiveness. As we transition, we’re looking for someone who can both build cutting-edge solutions and champion this shift within the company.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities


Build Models: Develop machine learning models (e.g., time series, RNNs) to forecast demand and optimisation systems to recommend prices dynamically.
Pilot AI Solutions: Design and implement a Proof of Concept (PoC) for dynamic pricing in a test market.
Evangelize AI Pricing: Advocate for the adoption of AI-driven pricing by demonstrating its value to key stakeholders across the business.
Analyse Large Data: Leverage Omio’s data and external factors (like competitor pricing) to optimize pricing decisions.
Drive Automation: Set up systems for real-time anomaly detection and automated price adjustments.


Collaborate: Work with Pricing Commercial, Product, and Engineering teams to integrate AI into business workflows and ensure smooth adoption.

Qualifications


At least 3 years experience in building complex models and algorithms.
Proven ability to design and deploy models in production, ideally for pricing or forecasting.
Strong communication and presentation skills to explain technical concepts and influence non-technical stakeholders at a C-level
Self-driven strong individual contributor requiring minimal hands on support
Experience in building production-ready AI systems from scratch is a big plus


Knowledge & Skills


Passion for driving organizational change and inspiring teams to adopt new, data-driven approaches.
Great communication skills with stakeholders (incl. C-Level)
Focus on solving real business problems rather than building models for theoretical problem-solving
Experience with time-series forecasting, anomaly detection, and Bayesian modelling.
Proficiency in Python, with experience in data science libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Experience of building low-latency / near real-time processing systems.


Additional Information

Here at Omio, we know that no two people are alike, and that’s a great thing. Diversity in culture, thought and background has been key to growing our product beyond borders to reach millions of users from all over the world. That’s why we believe in giving equal opportunity to all, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

What’s in it for you?

Omio encourage you to apply even if you’re still developing some of these skills! We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age or disability.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Scientist - Heat Pump Optimization (m/f/d)
Description:
We're looking for


you as a Lead Data Scientist - Heat Pump Optimization, to make an important contribution to climate neutrality together with us at thermondo. With your interest in renewable energies and your identification with our values, We do what we say, Better everyday, Stronger together, you will create real added value for us all.


As an experienced professional with over four years in a similar role, you will work closely with our team of thermal engineers to develop innovative, data-driven solutions that enhance our clean tech initiatives. Your expertise will be pivotal in optimizing our heat pump algorithms, ensuring they are efficient, effective, and seamlessly integrated into our IoT framework.

We value proactive problem-solving, cutting-edge optimization techniques, and the ability to communicate complex data insights across departments. If you are passionate about leveraging data science to drive a sustainable future, thermondo is your place.

If you enjoy this


Taking technical ownership of our heat pump optimization algorithms.
Analyzing time-series data from thousands of heat pump installations.
Collaborating with thermal engineers to quantitatively model the energy systems of residential homes.
Conceptualizing, building, and testing different optimization algorithms to save heating energy.
Developing testing criteria and a framework for backtesting new algorithms.
Building productive real-world optimization algorithms to execute via our IoT framework.


And recognise yourself here


A background in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Natural Sciences, Technology) is preferred, but not required, as diverse educational experiences are highly valued.
At least 4 years of experience in machine learning and solving general optimization problems, demonstrating expertise in this area.
Proficiency in analyzing and forecasting time series data is a notable strength.
Strong data analysis skills and the ability to communicate results effectively to the business, enabling the presentation of complex insights.
Experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) enhances the ability to manage and deploy data solutions.
Basic skills in data engineering and data integration complement the technical expertise.
Proficiency in Python, Looker, and Airflow tools is essential for success in this role.


What We Have To Offer


Join a team of dynamic, data-driven, and enthusiastic people who excel at their craft and are eager to share their knowledge and help you grow with them.
We offer a challenge with purpose - the better our tech, the more people will live climate-neutral and the better the world will become for future generations
A corporate culture that brings people from all walks of life together - regardless of gender, origin, age, or background.
A modern office in the heart of Berlin-Kreuzberg with a roof terrace, where dogs are welcome.
Work flexibly from the mobile office - up to 3 days a week.
Monthly company events such as Lunch & Learn and Drinks & Action.
Further your education! We offer regular opportunities for training and further education from our own Learning & Development team or external coaches.
A contribution to the company pension scheme.
Your well-being is important to us, which is why we invest in your physical and mental health and offer you 30 days of vacation, a permanent employment contract, and numerous other benefits via Corporate Benefits, as well as a discounted Urban Sports membership and access to nilo.health, a platform for mental health care.
Get around the city in a climate-friendly way with your JobRad.


About Us

Every application is welcome here - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion, ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation or identity. We are convinced that everyone is valuable and deserves a fair chance.

Software has always been part of thermondo’s DNA. We have been the first to digitize trade a decade ago. Today, our proprietary software enables 800 thermondinos to scale the heating transition in Germany. But we want more. We want to enable a fully digitized and smooth customer journey ensuring that all processes are coming together: commercial funnel, procurement, product, supply chain, project management, finance, dispatch, HR planning as well as customer-facing offerings for maintenance and home energy management.

Our product & tech teams in Xberg - the heart of Berlin - are a highly diverse and multicultural bunch. They make sure that we can make a difference and scale the energy transition in Germany and work closely together with all departments.

Join our product & tech teams and pave the way for climate-neutral living.

Your application process


An initial interview with your Talent Acquisition Manager, Svetlana
If we are both on the positive side, you will talk with Dominique, our VP Commercial Product & Data
The next step is to meet with your to-be teammates
Finally, Become a thermondino!


Here we go

Is this exactly the challenge you are looking for? Then don't wait any longer and apply to us. We look forward to getting to know you!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
UMATR are proud to be partnered with a software business looking to hire a talented Data Scientist to join their team. In this role, you’ll be diving deep into data to solve key business challenges, from identifying problem areas and designing experiments to driving impactful decision-making. Unlike traditional analytics roles, this position offers you the chance to create real, actionable insights that lead to change.




What You’ll Do:

Tackle Complex Problems: Use data to identify issues and design solutions that drive business results.
Experiment & Influence: Design experiments, run analyses, and influence key business decisions with your insights.
Work on Real-Time, High-Impact Data: Work with massive geolocational and temporal data in real time, across multiple cities with unique dynamics.
Collaboration & Ownership: You won’t just analyse data—you’ll be a key player, driving action and shaping business strategy from the frontlines.




What We Offer:

Challenging & Impactful Work: Tackle complex data problems while building the future of the online delivery space. Our work spans real-time data, varied city dynamics, and cross-functional collaboration.
A Unique Company Culture: We believe in doing common things uncommonly well, thinking big but staying humble, and treating others with kindness and respect.




What We’re Looking For:

Educational Background: A degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Experience: 4-5+ years in a data science or analytics role within an industry or research setting.
Technical Skills: Expertise in statistical analysis (hypothesis testing, experimentation, causal inference) using Python, R, or similar tools.
SQL Proficiency: Skilled at writing structured, efficient SQL queries to work with large data sets.
Visualisation & Dashboards: Experience creating clear and intuitive data visualisations and dashboards that influence business decisions, using tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
Problem-Solving Mindset: A relentless drive to find new ideas and data sources, with a systematic, data-driven approach to tackling ambiguous challenges.
Fluency in both English and German

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (Analytics), Courier
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a (Senior) Data Scientist (Analytics) to join Wolt’s Courier & Logistics mission!

As the international side of the Doordash business, Wolt is active in 27 countries outside of the US and growing. Together with functional and cross-functional partners, you’ll tackle highly impactful challenges to craft the most-loved platform for gig workers, and empower local businesses with our robust logistics system. Ultimately, your efforts will connect consumers to everything they desire.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, you’ll dive deep into our data to tackle crucial business challenges. You will diagnose problem areas, develop new metrics, design experiments, uncover foundational causal relationships in our data, and influence strategic decisions. This role combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement, positioning you at the forefront of driving business outcomes. You will work closely with Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement strategies and tactical decisions, helping to expand the Wolt platform globally.

In this role you will use data to optimize and quantify the onboarding of couriers and help us to reach the right number of couriers in the most efficient way to maximize the business outcome.

From day one you will work on questions such as


What’s the business impact of one missing courier or a delay in the onboarding process?
How do referrals impact courier performance and retention?
What are the main blockers in the onboarding funnel and how can we improve them?
Do automated processes perform better or worse than manual ones and how much so?


You will be the expert from the data side to answer the questions and own exploration, tracking, and experimentation.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Germany, Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations

A typical candidate for this role has over 3 years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting and a degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, or a related field.

We value the following attributes in an applicant:


proven track record in using data science to solve business or research problems
expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent
proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
good communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics to a technical and non-technical audience
good stakeholder management


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!


Show more

  • You can choose the location from our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Germany, Finland and Sweden. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
  • You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind. Read more about how we work.

Our humble expectations

A typical candidate for this role has over 3 years of experience in a data science or analytics position within an industry or research setting and a degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, or a related field.

We value the following attributes in an applicant:

  • proven track record in using data science to solve business or research problems
  • expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation, and regression analysis using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent
  • proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • good communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics to a technical and non-technical audience
  • good stakeholder management

Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Data Scientist Lead (m/f/d)
Company: Axel Springer National Media & Tech GmbH & Co. KG
Description:
Axel Springer National Media & Tech is responsible for over 60 products from more than 25 brands and some of Europe's biggest news sites including BILD.de and WELT.de. Together, the websites attract more than 1 Mio digital subscribers.

There are several cross-functional teams that are building exiting products, like ML driven recommendations and personalizations for Bild.de or predictions for the customer lifetime value of our subscribers. We build in the last years an environment that provides all the necessary data to build amazing ML projects on top.

Are you an experienced data science lead, ready to take on this challenge with us? Axel Springer National Media & Tech has made it its mission to reach the next level of publishing - help us to evolve, innovate and accelerate. Join our team to build the next generation of data driven tools for digital publishing.

Become a

data-loving scientist and shape with us the future of our subscription business



you teach and guide a diverse team of Data Scientists on their respective projects
you play a crucial role in the stakeholder communication to explain all the "statistical magic" into plain english or german and help them to understand
you become the 'go-to' person for the mechanics of our products and the underlying data
you become an expert for our customers and marketing activities and a trusted advisor for our stakeholders
you become an expert for our recommendation systems and play a pivotal role in making there the next steps
you validate your ideas by analyzing historical data
you design, implement, and analyze A/B tests
next to your coaching and advisory topics, you take ownership for our projects and production pipelines, working hand-in-hand with your colleagues in the team to deliver high quality results
you are a teacher and learner from everyone in the organization
you are an advocate for data driven decisions – explain stakeholders what data we have and how to use it




You are a

solutions oriented team player with a passion for data



you are a data scientist with at least 5 years of experience and extensive management experience
you like to make sense out of huge amounts of data and you want to see your algorithms work in production
ideally you have a phd in statistics
you are a proactive and independent problem solver who has the ability to visualize and articulate complex issues and can communicate effectively with non-technical colleagues
you have a strong knowledge of Python and the libraries for data manipulation and machine learning
you write clean, readable and maintainable code
experience with projects relating to CRM, CLV modeling, churn prediction and expertise in marketing would be a plus
you have worked with Spark, R, Shiny or AWS before
ideally you have worked with Palantir Foundry or comparable managed data platforms
you are fluent in English, German is a big plus (stakeholder communication)
experience with behavioral user data and A/B tests would also be a plus




Benefit from a

culture of personal development, purposeful work, and a fun & supportive team



your personal growth is important to us: we offer trainings and learning lunches, tech conferences, a budget for workshops and much more to expand your knowledge and your skills
a collaborative culture where cross-functional work allows you to explore other developers' domains, and your ideas are encouraged to stay ahead of the market by learning, evaluating, and implementing the latest technologies
flexible working time and hybrid work create an ideal work life balance
30 days of vacation and 20 days for working abroad
free lunch - in our onsite restaurants
free choice of top-notch office equipment, up-to-date hardware, software and modern office spaces
from now a permanent full- or part-time position in a modern office in the heart of Berlin: http://www.axelspringer-neubau.de/




Getting curious? Check out what we are doing on GitHub or check out our Techblog.

Questions and answers about the application process

Contact person for this position (reference number REF2172B) is Marcel Burmester

The most frequently asked questions and their answers can be found on our FAQ page: career.axelspringer.com/en/faq

Diversity is an essential part of our corporate culture! We are looking forward to receiving all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion, ideology, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity.

You can find information about the representation for the severely disabled at Axel Springer here: https://career.axelspringer.com/en/rsde

Title: Research Sciences Intern (VISION)
Description:
Overview

Come build community, explore your passions and do your best work at Microsoft with thousands of University interns from every corner of the world. This opportunity will allow you to bring your aspirations, talent, potential—and excitement for the journey ahead.

The Applied Sciences Group (ASG) is seeking a highly motivated and talented PhD student to join our team as a Research Intern. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge research in the fields of Large Language Models (LLMs), Vision-Language Models (VLMs), and Generative Image & Video. The successful candidate will collaborate with a team of experienced researchers and engineers to tackle real-world challenges and contribute to the advancement of AI technologies.

Responsibilities


Conduct research in one or more of the following areas: LLMs, VLMs, and Generative Image & Video.
Design and implement experiments to test new hypotheses and validate research findings.
Develop and optimise algorithms and models for various AI applications.
Collaborate with team members to integrate research outcomes into practical solutions.
Present research findings to the team and contribute to publications and patents.


Qualifications

Required: Qualifications:


Currently pursuing a PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Strong background in LLMs, VLMs, or Generative Image & Video.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch ).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex ideas clearly.


Preferred Qualifications


Strong track record of success, evidenced by publications in prestigious computer vision and machine learning conferences, including NeurIPS , ECCV, ICCV, CVPR .
Proven software engineering capabilities, evidenced by professional experience, internships, impactful open-source contributions, and success in coding competitions.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Delivery
Description:
Join our Delivery Data Science team build advanced models, and help shape the future of online services while improving user experiences for millions worldwide.

About Us

With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.

We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!

About The Role

You will be building models to estimate the food delivery time at various stages of the order, such as before and after the order has been accepted. You will also build complex ranking pipelines for our textual search and recommendation engines, using optimization techniques for dispatching and demand/supply balancing to minimize the delivery time of our orders.

Main tasks and responsibilities:


Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Data Analysts, Data Egineers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers, to gain a deep understanding of business needs and create end-to-end technical solutions for them.
Deploying and validating solutions for millions of users, enabling fast feedback and measurable added value to customers.
Rapidly deploying models to production environments using AWS and internal machine learning platforms, leveraging a toolkit that includes Python, Spark, Presto, Docker, SageMaker, and Airflow for efficient data processing and model deployment.
Engaging in regular knowledge exchange with Data Scientists across all seniority levels, fostering a collaborative environment that promotes learning and innovation.
Solving real-world problems on a wide variety of tasks, such as ranking, textual search, recommendation, user clustering, pricing, delivery time estimation, dispatching, and demand/supply balancing.
Applying the most advanced techniques, such as deep learning, gradient boosting, causal inference, mathematical optimization, dimensionality reduction, time series forecasting, and more.



About you:


You have 5 years of experience in Data Science and Machine Learning, ideally in product development within a technology-focused company.
You’re skilled in Python programming, leveraging key libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, and OR-tools for data analysis and modelling, with practical experience in statistical hypothesis testing that allows you to independently identify problems, explore trends, and discover opportunities through data-driven methods.
You have a proactive mindset, a willingness to take initiative and work with little supervision, and enthusiasm for collaborating with different roles in product, analytics, and engineering to identify problems, explore trends, and discover growth opportunities.
You exhibit excellent teamwork and strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written, enabling clear collaboration and knowledge-sharing.
You have hands-on experience in building ML systems from end to end, including testing, monitoring, scaling, and measuring the impact.



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 3 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.
Show more

Title: Data Science Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir zeichnen uns durch Flexibilität und Begeisterung gegenüber technologischen Trends und Innovationen aus. Bei Dataciders ixto erwartet Dich ein sehr gutes teamorientiertes Betriebsklima und eine angenehme Arbeitsatmosphäre mit einem motivierten, vielseitigen Team aus unterschiedlichen Bereichen wie Informationstechnik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, uvm. Du erhältst die Chance, das Unternehmen und die Unternehmenskultur durch Deinen Beitrag und Deine Ideen ständig weiterzuentwickeln.

DATA SCIENCE DEVELOPER (M/W/D)

Festangestellung Dataciders ixto GmbH, Vollzeit

Was Dich in Deiner neuen Aufgabe erwartet


Innovative Projekte zu Machine Learning und Künstlicher Intelligenz
Öffentlich geförderte Forschungsprojekte in gesellschaftlich relevanten Zukunftsthemen
Projektrealisierungen in State-of-the-Art Technologien
Unterstützung bei der Implementierung und Bereitstellung moderner Cloud- und Microservice-Architekturen


Was wir uns von Dir wünschen


Hohe Lern- und Begeisterungsfähigkeit für Daten und Cloud-Technologien
Abgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Berufsausbildung - wichtig sind uns Deine ausgeprägten Fähigkeiten in analytischem Denken
Kenntnisse in einer der folgenden Sprachen: Python, Java, PowerShell, C# oder JavaScript
Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Plattformen wie Microsoft Azure, AWS und GCP sind von Vorteil
Erfahrungen im Bereich Datenbankentwicklung sind von Vorteil
Selbstbewusstes Auftreten, Kundenorientierung und Kommunikationsstärke
Teamfähigkeit und Reisebereitschaft
Sprachkenntnisse: Deutsch (C1), Englisch (C1)


Was wir Dir bieten

Wir sind ein führender Anbieter für die Realisierung maßgeschneiderter Daten-Lösungen, welche die Grundlage für wichtige Entscheidungen in Fachabteilungen und unternehmensweit bilden.


Ein junges Team aus wissbegierigen Talenten und erfahrenen Beratern
Eine Arbeitsumgebung, die Eigenverantwortung und individuelle Entwicklung fördert
Ständiger Wissensaustausch und eine Team-Kultur, die persönliches Wachstum fördert
Zahlreiche Teamevents

Dann bewirb Dich jetzt!

Title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Zur Verstärkung unseres Data Teams in Hamburg, Berlin oder Essen suchen wir Dich als

Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/w/d)

DEINE AUFGABEN


Du bist Mitglied des Data Teams im Bereich Subscription & Tech und gemeinsam verantworten wir dort alles rund ums Thema Data Analytics, von fachlicher Trackingkonzeption bis Analyse
Du bist für die Aufbereitung, Transformation und Auswertung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellsystemen zuständig und stellst eine bestmögliche Qualität der Daten sicher
Du beantwortest Fragestellungen aus den Bereichen Vertrieb, Redaktion und Produktmanagement mit datenbasierten Handlungsempfehlungen
Ob einfache Analyse, Dashboard oder Machine Learning Modell – Du setzt das richtige Mittel für den jeweiligen Zweck ein
Wir haben kniffelige Fragestellungen und Du Spaß am Detail – Du kannst aber auch „pragmatisch“, wenn die schnelle Lösung gefordert ist



DEIN PROFIL


Idealerweise bringst Du mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung mit und begeisterst Dich für Daten und Analysen
Du bist bereits Digital Analytics Expert*in oder hast den unbedingten Willen eine*r zu werden
Du beherrschst den direkten Umgang mit Daten mittels SQL und hast Erfahrung mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache wie Python oder R
Du schaust gerne über den Tellerrand und hast idealerweise erste Erfahrungen mit Data Science oder Machine Learning gesammelt
Du bist offen, kommunikativ und teamfähig, arbeitest sorgfältig, fokussierst Dich auf Deine Ziele und hast ein hohes Maß an Eigenantrieb



Deine Benefits


Innovation trifft Tradition: Du gestaltest die digitale Transformation unserer Mediengruppe mit
Entwickle Dich mit uns: Wir ermöglichen Dir die Teilnahme an individuellen Coachings, Workshops oder (Online)-Trainings im Rahmen unserer FUNKE Akademie
Flexibel arbeiten: Wir leben ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell, weil uns Deine Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist
Teamwork: Dich erwarten ein dynamisches Team, eine offene Feedbackkultur, kurze Kommunikationswege und ein herzliches Miteinander
Corporate Benefits: Wir bieten Dir ein Benefit-Portal mit attraktiven Rabatten und Abos
Halte Dich fit und gesund: Profitiere von unseren Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und lasse Dich für Deine mentale und körperliche Gesundheit individuell beraten



Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann gestalte mit uns die Zukunft und sende uns Deine Bewerbung an Steffen Flach.
Show more
HTML:
Zur Verstärkung unseres Data Teams in Hamburg, Berlin oder Essen suchen wir Dich als

Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/w/d)

DEINE AUFGABEN

  • Du bist Mitglied des Data Teams im Bereich Subscription & Tech und gemeinsam verantworten wir dort alles rund ums Thema Data Analytics, von fachlicher Trackingkonzeption bis Analyse
  • Du bist für die Aufbereitung, Transformation und Auswertung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellsystemen zuständig und stellst eine bestmögliche Qualität der Daten sicher
  • Du beantwortest Fragestellungen aus den Bereichen Vertrieb, Redaktion und Produktmanagement mit datenbasierten Handlungsempfehlungen
  • Ob einfache Analyse, Dashboard oder Machine Learning Modell – Du setzt das richtige Mittel für den jeweiligen Zweck ein
  • Wir haben kniffelige Fragestellungen und Du Spaß am Detail – Du kannst aber auch „pragmatisch“, wenn die schnelle Lösung gefordert ist


DEIN PROFIL

  • Idealerweise bringst Du mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung mit und begeisterst Dich für Daten und Analysen
  • Du bist bereits Digital Analytics Expert*in oder hast den unbedingten Willen eine*r zu werden
  • Du beherrschst den direkten Umgang mit Daten mittels SQL und hast Erfahrung mit mindestens einer Programmiersprache wie Python oder R
  • Du schaust gerne über den Tellerrand und hast idealerweise erste Erfahrungen mit Data Science oder Machine Learning gesammelt
  • Du bist offen, kommunikativ und teamfähig, arbeitest sorgfältig, fokussierst Dich auf Deine Ziele und hast ein hohes Maß an Eigenantrieb


Deine Benefits

  • Innovation trifft Tradition: Du gestaltest die digitale Transformation unserer Mediengruppe mit
  • Entwickle Dich mit uns: Wir ermöglichen Dir die Teilnahme an individuellen Coachings, Workshops oder (Online)-Trainings im Rahmen unserer FUNKE Akademie
  • Flexibel arbeiten: Wir leben ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell, weil uns Deine Work-Life-Balance wichtig ist
  • Teamwork: Dich erwarten ein dynamisches Team, eine offene Feedbackkultur, kurze Kommunikationswege und ein herzliches Miteinander
  • Corporate Benefits: Wir bieten Dir ein Benefit-Portal mit attraktiven Rabatten und Abos
  • Halte Dich fit und gesund: Profitiere von unseren Kooperationen mit verschiedensten Fitnessstudios und lasse Dich für Deine mentale und körperliche Gesundheit individuell beraten


Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt? Dann gestalte mit uns die Zukunft und sende uns Deine Bewerbung an Steffen Flach.

Title: Data Scientist - Customer Logistics, Choice
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist - Customer Logistics, Choice to join the Logistics Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

The Customer Logistics tribe’s mission is to build products that make it easy for local brands to run efficient operations and deliver a delightful order experience to customers so they order on repeat. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions affecting every customer journey across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.


Drive the development and implementation of statistical, machine learning, and optimization models for choice optimization, rider fleet busyness and travel time prediction, and demand control. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the efficiency and performance of the machine learning models in across the vertical.
Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities by deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve decision-making in the domain.
Work on research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in machine learning and data science, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's digital products and algorithms. Stay informed about industry developments and incorporate new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows.


What you need to be successful


You excel at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver value to the business.
You have expertise in building and training advanced machine learning models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit ideally centring around Pandas, SQL, Sklearn, and PySpark.
Through the fluent use of SQL queries, you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine-learning solutions.
You write clean, production-level code and effectively use software versioning with Git.
You are familiar with deploying and developing in cloud systems, ideally with experience in GCP and bigquery.
You love to learn and are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence; you are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different tech teams in a diverse environment.


Nice to have:


Proven experience in addressing large-scale optimization problems (linear or mixed integer programming) is a strong asset.
Hands-on experience in creating causal models and deploying them in production is a plus.
Experience in designing and analysing advanced products/models experiments (switchback tests, quasi-experiments, non-standard A/B tests etc) is a plus.
Experience in working on logistics product development would be a great benefit.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.




Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Scientist & AI Engineer (w|m|d)
Description:
About

Die BridgingIT GmbH besteht seit 2008 und ist heute Teil der bridgingIT-Gruppe. Bei uns bist du an einem unserer 10 zentralen und kundennahen Standorte in Deutschland tätig. Du wirst Teil einer herstellerunabhängigen und produktneutralen Technologie- und Unternehmensberatung. In deinen Projekten setzt du für Start-ups, Mittelstand und Konzerne aus verschiedenen Branchen deren Digitalisierungsstrategien in den Bereichen Technologien, Methoden und Wertschöpfung ganzheitlich um. Wir sind eine wertebasierte Organisation mit Verantwortungskultur: Werte wie menschliche Nähe, Vielfalt und Vertrauen prägen deinen Arbeitsalltag. Die 700 Kolleginnen und Kollegen unserer Gruppe finden bei uns Karriere- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten, Flexibilität und Familienfreundlichkeit.

Du hast Spaß im Umgang mit Daten und ein Talent dafür, aus ihnen Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen. Es reizt dich, aus fachlichen Use Cases vollständige Data Science Lösungen abzuleiten und diese im Team umzusetzen. In unseren Analytics Teams triffst du auf Menschen, die deine Leidenschaft teilen.

Bewirb dich jetzt und werde ein Teil unserer Analytics & Data-driven Solutions Community!

Standort(e): Berlin, Hamburg, Mannheim

Art: Festanstellung, Vollzeit, Teilzeit und mobiles Arbeiten
